thread.title: Jimmy Fallon honored by Harvard Lampoon
thread.title_full: Jimmy Fallon honored by Harvard Lampoon

author: wtopstaff
title: Jimmy Fallon honored by Harvard Lampoon
text:
Home » News » Entertainment » TV » Jimmy Fallon honored by… Jimmy Fallon honored by Harvard Lampoon By The Associated Press October 25, 2015 4:50 am FILE - In this Aug. 25, 2014, file photo, Jimmy Fallon presents an award at the 66th Annual Primetime Emmy Awards in Los Angeles. Fallon got the royal treatment at Harvard. "The Tonight Show" host and "Saturday Night Live" alum was honored Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, by the Harvard Lampoon, the country's oldest continuously published humor magazine. (Photo by Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP, File) 
CAMBRIDGE, Mass. (AP) — Jimmy Fallon got the royal treatment at Harvard. 
The “Tonight Show” host and “Saturday Night Live” alum was honored Saturday by the Harvard Lampoon, the country’s oldest continuously published humor magazine. 
The magazine awarded Fallon its Elmer Award for Excellence in Humor. 
The comedian was crowned “Emperor of Comedy” and paraded through Harvard Square in a Roman chariot. The parade started by the Inn at Harvard and ended at the steps of the magazine’s headquarters, Lampoon Castle, where he was presented with a trophy and an 85-cent check. 
It’s just the seventh time the undergraduate organization says it has bestowed the honor. Previous recipients include Jay Leno, John Cleese and Robin Williams. 
The 41-year-old Fallon took over “The Tonight Show” from Leno last year. Topics:
